content:
Glad to be of help! Here are a few more healthy snack ideas that you can make in bulk and store:

1. Homemade Trail Mix

Ingredients:
- 1 cup unsalted mixed nuts (almonds, cashews, pecans, walnuts)
- 1 cup unsalted sunflower seeds
- 1 cup pumpkin seeds
- 1 cup dried fruit (raisins, cranberries, apricots)
- 1/2 cup dark chocolate chips

Directions:
1. Mix all of the ingredients in a large bowl. 2. Store the mix in an airtight container for up to one month. 2. Fruit & Yogurt Parfait

Ingredients:
- Greek yogurt
- Fresh fruit (berries, peaches, pineapple, etc.) - Low-sugar granola
- Honey (optional)

Directions:
1. Layer the Greek yogurt, fresh fruit, and granola in a mason jar or container. 2. Drizzle honey on top if desired. 3. Store in the fridge for up to 3 days. 3. Roasted Veggie Chips

Ingredients:
- 2 large carrots
- 2 large parsnips
- 2 large sweet potatoes
- 2-3 tbsp of olive oil
- Sea salt to taste

Directions:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C). 2. Peel and thinly slice the vegetables. 3. In a bowl, toss the vegetables with olive oil and sea salt. 4. Arrange the vegetables in a single layer on a baking sheet. 5. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until crisp. 6. Once cooled, store in an airtight container for up to one week. I hope you enjoy these healthy snack ideas that can be made in bulk and stored for later!
